_comment: Add a _ before an option name to comment it out and it wont be added to the apworld
Using 'goal' as the name of an option let you override some of the generated goal parameters
goal.description: How to End your Randomized playthrough.

description: Which mode would you like to play on?
Story Mode:
Played in story mode.
Clear stages to send checks.
Exit out of the run if you die more times than you have life items.
Clear stage 9 to receive ending items.
Match Mode:
Played in match mode vs cpu opponents.
Defeat opponents by surviving a specified amount of time against them to send checks.
Reduced Timer items reduces time needed to survive opponents.
Defeat your characters' final opponent to receive ending items.

endings_required.description: How many ending items should be required to goal?

description: Should playable characters be locked behind items?
If false, character items are replaced with resource items.
For Match Mode, base survival time is also increased to compensate for more resources.

match_random_opponents.description: [Match Mode] Should character opponents be randomized? If false, characters you fight will be ordered like story mode.

description: [Story Mode] Should life items be required to make stage 6, 7 and 8 in-logic?
3 Lives: 1 life item makes stage 6 in-logic, 2 life items for stage 7, 3 life items for stage 8.
2 Lives: 1 life item makes stage 6 in-logic, 2 life items for stage 7 and 8.
1 Life: 1 life item makes all 3 stages in-logic.
None: All 3 stages are in-logic without the need of life items.

story_end_game_lives.description: [Story Mode] How many life items should be required to make stage 9 in-logic?

match_minimum_time.description: [Match Mode] What should be the minimum required survival time to make opponents in-logic?

description: [Match Mode] Increase base survival time? By default, 1 minute is the shortest possible time for starter and final opponents.
match_minimum_time may need to be increased to compensate.

ayamedi_progression.description: Should Aya and Medicine require any of their resource items to make their locations in-logic?

description: Out of the enabled ones, how many characters do you want the randomizer to pick and choose who stays enabled, and disable the rest?
Set to 0 to disable this feature.
